DOC.brief_summary: Osteoporosis pseudoglioma (OPPG) syndrome is a rare autosomal recessive condition of childhood osteoporosis and congenital blindness for which new treatments are needed. We have found that body fat is increased in OPPG and muscle mass is reduced. We hypothesize that growth hormone therapy will improve muscle mass and bone strength in OPPG.
DOC.brief_title: Growth Hormone for Osteoporosis Pseudoglioma Syndrome
DOC.criteria: Osteoporosis pseudoglioma syndrome Age 4 years and above not on medication for osteoporosis pregnant Age under 4 yrs Active malignancy
